snippet: Beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to phones close by, have quickly become a new front in the chase to find you whenever and wherever you are.
abstract: Molly Wood Machine Learning column notes that beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to mobile applications on phones close by, have quickly become new front in advertising industry's attempts to find consumers whenever and wherever they are; notes while they will probably be used for spam for now, devices could make the world around phone users richer, more useful and more interactive.
lead_paragraph: Beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to phones close by, have quickly become a new front in the chase to find you whenever and wherever you are.

headline.main: Businesses Are Turning to Beacons, and It’s Going to Be O.K.
headline.print_headline: Businesses Are Beckoning, and It’s Going to Be O.K.
